skill.name: tilt
skill.description: Manages Tilt development environments via CLI and Tiltfile authoring. Must use when working with Tilt or Tiltfiles.
skill.summary: Manages Tilt development environments via CLI and Tiltfile authoring. Must use when working with Til...
skill.author: 0xBigBoss

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation/reference skill containing only Markdown files. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities. The skill provides reference material for Tilt CLI and Tiltfile API usage.

content.value_statement: Tilt accelerates Kubernetes development with live reloading and unified workflows. This skill provides essential CLI commands and Tiltfile API references for efficient container-based development.
actual_capabilities: Run and manage tilt up in tmux sessions for persistent development
Query resource status via tilt get uiresources with JSON output
Retrieve and filter logs using tilt logs with time and pattern filters
Trigger manual updates and wait for resource readiness
Author Tiltfiles with docker_build, k8s_yaml, and local_resource functions
Configure live update steps for fast container synchronization
limitations: Does not install or configure Tilt itself
Does not manage Kubernetes clusters directly
Does not build or push container images
Reference-only skill - does not execute commands on user systems

use_cases.title: Accelerate local development
use_cases.description: Set up live-reloading development environments that sync code changes to containers without full rebuilds

use_cases.title: Configure build workflows
use_cases.description: Define Tiltfiles with docker builds, k8s resources, and custom commands for multi-service applications

use_cases.title: Run tilt ci for automation
use_cases.description: Execute batch builds that wait for all resources to reach steady state before exiting

output_examples.input: Start tilt up in a tmux session for this project
output: Started tilt in tmux session: myproject
Resources will auto-reload on file changes

best_practices: Always run tilt up in tmux to survive Claude Code session reloads
Use live_update steps for fast synchronization instead of full rebuilds
Verify updates propagated by checking tilt logs after saving files
anti_patterns: Manually restarting tilt up after every file change - let live reload handle it
Running tilt up directly in foreground without tmux
Using TRIGGER_MODE_MANUAL for all resources when auto mode would work better

faq.question: Which operating systems support Tilt?
faq.answer: Tilt runs on macOS, Linux, and Windows via WSL. Requires Docker and Kubernetes access.

faq.question: How many resources can Tilt manage?
faq.answer: Tilt handles dozens of resources. Use labels for grouping and update_settings to control parallelism.

faq.question: Can Tilt integrate with existing CI pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, use tilt ci for batch mode that exits when all resources are ready or on error.

faq.question: Is data from my Tiltfiles sent externally?
faq.answer: Tilt runs locally and only communicates with your configured Kubernetes cluster. No external data collection.

faq.question: Why is my resource not auto-reloading?
faq.answer: Check if live_update is configured, ensure trigger_mode is AUTO, and verify file paths in deps are correct.

faq.question: How does Tilt compare to Skaffold or Garden?
faq.answer: Tilt focuses on unified workflows with strong live-update capabilities and a web UI for real-time feedback.
